content.title: Subsidy for Asset Creation for Intellectual Property: Subsidy on the Cost of Trade Mark Registration or Geographical Indications (GI) in India or Abroad
content.department: Micro Small and Medium Enterprises Department
content.beneficiary: Micro, small, and medium manufacturing enterprises
content.details: The scheme 'Subsidy for Asset Creation for Intellectual Property: Subsidy on the Cost of Trade Mark Registration or Geographical Indications (GI) in India or Abroad' by the Micro Small and Medium Enterprises Department, Government of Tamil Nadu, is introduced to incentivize MSMEs to innovate and create intellectual property in India and Abroad as a differentiator. No documents are required to avail of the benefits for reimbursement up to ₹1,00,000.
benefits: 50% subsidy on the cost of applying for Trade Mark Registration including the cost of the first-time maintenance fee of the granted application, subject to a maximum of ₹ 25,000 per Trade Mark or Geographical Indications registered.
eligibility: All new and existing micro, small and medium manufacturing enterprises including clusters located anywhere in Tamil Nadu.
documents_required: Copy of Products Registered under Trade Mark Registration as per Trade Marks Act 1999 'TM Act'.
Copy of Patent Registered and Issued by the Competitive Authority as per Indian Patent Act 1970.
Copy of the Registered Goods under the Geographical Indication of Goods Registration and Protection Act, 1999.

Self-Certified Statement on Expenditure Incurred for Obtaining Geographical Registration with a Copy of the Bills/Vouchers and Receipt, etc. In Case of Non-Availability of Receipts, the Bank Scroll That Shows the Payment Details.
Copy of Loan Sanction Letter, if Availed, for Obtaining the Registration Purpose from Bank/Financial Institutions.
Copy of Invoices and Receipts for the Payment Made.

faqs.question: What is the reimbursement timeline for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Reimbursement needs to be claimed within 6 months from the date of obtaining Patent/Trade Mark Registration/Geographical Indications.

faqs.question: Is there a specific link to check eligibility under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants can check their eligibility at https://www.msmeonline.tn.gov.in/incentives/know_your_eligibility.php.

faqs.question: Are there any additional fees covered by the subsidy apart from the Trade Mark Registration cost?
faqs.answer: Yes, the subsidy covers the cost of the first-time maintenance fee of the granted application under Trade Mark Registration.

faqs.question: Is the subsidy applicable to both new and existing enterprises?
faqs.answer: Yes, both new and existing micro, small, and medium manufacturing enterprises are eligible to apply for the subsidy.

faqs.question: Can existing enterprises located outside Tamil Nadu apply for this subsidy?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is applicable only to micro, small, and medium manufacturing enterprises, including clusters, located within Tamil Nadu.

faqs.question: What is the maximum subsidy amount provided for Trade Mark Registration or Geographical Indications?
faqs.answer: The maximum subsidy provided is ₹25,000 per Trade Mark or Geographical Indication registered under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is there a specific online portal for submitting applications?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants can submit their applications through the official portal: https://www.msmeonline.tn.gov.in/incentives/patent_trade.php.

faqs.question: Are there any specific conditions for the file format and size while submitting documents?
faqs.answer: Yes, the file format should be PDF (.pdf), and the file size should be less than 200 kb.

faqs.question: How can an applicant track the status of their application?
faqs.answer: Applicants can track the status of their application by visiting the URL: https://www.msmeonline.tn.gov.in/incentives/app_track.php?id=Track%20Your%20Status.

faqs.question: What are the key documents required for availing the subsidy benefits?
faqs.answer: The required documents include a UDYAM Registration Certificate, product registration under Trade Mark Registration, Patent registration, Geographical Indication of Goods registration, self-certified statement on expenditure, loan sanction letter (if applicable), and related invoices.

faqs.question: How much reimbursement can an eligible enterprise receive under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible enterprises can receive reimbursement up to ₹1,00,000 for the cost of Trade Mark Registration, including the maintenance fee, with a maximum subsidy of ₹25,000 per Trade Mark or Geographical Indication registered.
